name: ESSAI 2026
venue: European Summer School on Artificial Intelligence, Vienna, Austria
description: The 4th European Summer School on Artificial Intelligence (ESSAI) will take place in Vienna, Austria from 6 to 10 July 2026, targeting PhD students and young researchers in AI. It offers a five‑day intensive program of introductory and advanced AI courses, specialized tutorials, and parallel tracks featuring over 30 international lecturers. In addition to the academic sessions, the school provides networking opportunities and a rich social programme, including a reception at Vienna City Hall.

name: OpenEuroLLM Winter School
venue: Skeikampen conference hotel, near Oslo, Norway
description: The 2026 Winter School on Multilinguality in LLM Development and Evaluation is organized by the Nordic Language Processing Laboratory and the University of Oslo and takes place at the Skeikampen conference hotel north of Oslo, Norway. It targets NLP researchers, especially those from EuroHPC consortium countries and doctoral students, and focuses on multilingual large language models, their evaluation, data curation, and dialectal challenges. The program combines technical talks, hands‑on sessions, and field trips with bus transfers from Oslo Airport, and participation is subsidized by the OpenEuroLLM project.

name: Probabilistic AI School
description: The ProbAI School 2026 is a Probabilistic AI summer school taking place in Vilnius, Lithuania. It aims to provide an inclusive educational environment covering state‑of‑the‑art machine‑learning and artificial‑intelligence topics. The program welcomes students, academics, industry professionals and AI enthusiasts to learn and collaborate.

name: BMVA Computer Vision Summer School
description: The 29th BMVA Computer Vision Summer School will be held at Durham University in Durham, England, UK. It offers an intensive week of lectures and lab sessions covering a wide range of computer‑vision topics presented by leading researchers from the UK and abroad. The programme features daily oral talks, hands‑on labs, and opportunities for networking among students and experts in the field.

name: Oxford Machine Learning Summer School 2026
description: OxML Summer 2026 is a programme that combines in‑person sessions in Oxford with online components. It offers three specialised AI tracks taught by world‑renowned experts from leading academic and industry labs, allowing participants to customise their learning path. Applications are not yet open, and interested candidates are invited to sign up for notifications about the registration start.

name: Robotics, Perception and Learning (RPL) Summer School
venue: KTH Royal Institute of Technology, Stockholm, Sweden
description: The RPL Summer School 2026 is a six‑day event for doctoral and postdoctoral researchers organized by the Department for Robotics, Perception and Learning at KTH Royal Institute of Technology in Stockholm, Sweden. It covers a broad range of topics in robotics, perception and learning, including machine learning, computer vision, human‑robot interaction, planning and decision making, and combines keynote talks, industry panels, and brainstorming sessions to foster new collaborations. The school takes place at the Happy Tammsvik resort, providing participants with accommodation, meals and various indoor and outdoor activities in a relaxed setting.

name: Machine Learning Crash Course at MALGA
description: The MLCC2026 Summer School provides an introduction to fundamental machine‑learning concepts and algorithms. It is aimed at undergraduate and graduate students, as well as professionals, and combines theoretical lectures with hands‑on lab sessions. The in‑person course takes place at the University of Genoa’s DIBRIS/DIMA building in Genoa, Italy, offering direct access to faculty from the MaLGa Center.

name: UK Robotics Summer School
venue: National Robotarium, Heriot-Watt University, Edinburgh, United Kingdom
description: The UK Robotics Summer School 2026 is a five‑day program held in Edinburgh that brings together master’s‑level students and industry practitioners to explore robotics. It offers expert‑led lectures, tutorials and industry talks covering bio‑inspired robotics, healthcare robotics, generative AI, safe AI and real‑world applications, with hands‑on experience using state‑of‑the‑art technology. Participants also benefit from networking opportunities, a special dinner and a supportive environment provided by the National Robotarium at Heriot‑Watt University.

name: International Summer School for Advanced Studies on Biometrics, Behavior, and Vision
description: The 2026 Biometrics Summer School takes place in Alghero, Sardinia, Italy, hosted by Hotel Dei Pini. It focuses on the impact of generative AI and large foundation models on biometric and human recognition technologies, covering machine learning, image understanding, signal analysis, neuroscience, robotics, forensic and digital forensics. The program is aimed at PhD students, post‑docs, researchers, forensic examiners and professionals, offering intensive lectures by leading experts, hands‑on sessions, and opportunities for scholarships and networking.

name: 1st Internationa School on the Cognitive, Ethical, and Societal Dimensions of AI - AIces
description: AIces 2026 is the first International School on the Cognitive, Ethical and Societal Dimensions of Artificial Intelligence, held in Porto, Portugal. The school targets graduate and postgraduate students as well as industry practitioners, offering parallel courses, symposia, and open debates on cognition, ethics, and society of AI. It combines face‑to‑face interaction with live online participation, records all lectures for 45 days, and provides a certificate of participation.

name: Winter School on Ethical, Legal, and Societal (ELS) aspects of AI and AS at Umeå University
description: The Winter School on Ethical, Legal, and Societal aspects of AI and Autonomous Systems is held at Umeå University in Sweden. It offers lectures, multidisciplinary hands‑on training, a poster session, and a social program to foster networking among researchers and students. The event targets participants interested in the societal impact of AI and AS, providing them with practical experience and professional exchange.

name: Winter School on Social Robotics, Artificial Intelligence and Multimedia (SoRAIM 2026)
description: The Winter School on Social Robotics, Artificial Intelligence and Multimedia (SoRAIM) 2026 takes place at the Escandille in Autrans, France. It aims to bring together researchers from fields such as computer vision, speech/audio processing, and human‑robot interaction to foster cross‑disciplinary exchange through courses and informal networking. The program features expert talks on topics like affective signal processing, conversational speech synthesis, and hands‑on sessions on human‑robot interaction, set against the backdrop of the Vercors mountains.

name: Machine Learning Summer School (MLSS) Melbourne
venue: Sandridge Events Centre, Port Melbourne, Australia
description: The 2026 Machine Learning Summer School (MLSS) takes place at the Sandridge Events Centre in Melbourne, Australia. It is a two‑week, in‑person program aimed at 50 hand‑picked PhD students and early‑career researchers, covering core machine‑learning theory and emerging topics beyond large language models. World‑class speakers from academia and industry deliver lectures, tutorials, and networking opportunities across a broad range of topics such as deep learning, generative modeling, reinforcement learning, and AI in industry.

name: Northern Lights Deep Learning Winter School
venue: UiT The Arctic University of Norway, Tromsø, Norway
description: The 2027 Winter School is part of the Northern Lights Deep Learning Conference and will be held at UiT The Arctic University of Norway in Tromsø. It runs from 11 to 15 January 2027 and covers recent advances in deep learning, including image classification, object detection, segmentation, time‑series prediction, and speech recognition. Registration has not yet opened, and interested participants should monitor the conference website for future updates.

name: Annual Nepal AI School (ANAIS)
description: The Sixth Annual Nepal AI School (ANAIS) is an 11‑day intensive program that offers lectures, labs, and project work covering AI fundamentals to cutting‑edge applications. It welcomes a diverse audience including senior undergraduates, graduate students, PhD candidates, faculty members, and industry professionals, with more than 500 in‑person participants and thousands of livestream viewers. The school aims to build AI expertise in the region, foster collaborations, and inspire the next generation of AI leaders from developing countries.

name: EEML Summer School
venue: Eastern European Machine Learning Summer School, Cetinje, Montenegro
description: The Eastern European Machine Learning Summer School takes place in Cetinje, Montenegro from 27 July to 1 August 2026. It offers a series of lectures and tutorials on modern machine‑learning topics delivered by leading researchers from institutions such as Google DeepMind, University of Oxford, and MIT Media Lab. The program is aimed at graduate students and early‑career researchers interested in advancing their knowledge and networking within the Eastern European AI community.

name: Mediterranean Summer School
venue: University of Split Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering and Naval Architecture, Split, Croatia
description: The Mediterranean Machine Learning (M2L) Summer School offers a focused five‑day program of keynotes, lectures, and practical sessions led by experienced AI experts. It targets doctoral and exceptional master students, as well as academics and practitioners, with topics ranging from computer vision and natural language processing to generative models and reinforcement learning. The school also encourages networking through poster sessions, cultural activities, and informal interactions with speakers and sponsors.

name: Summer School on Multimodal Foundation Models and Generative AI
venue: Institut National des Postes et Télécommunications, Rabat, Morocco
description: The 2nd edition of the AI Summer School on Multimodal Foundation Models and Generative AI is a five‑day immersive program jointly organized by MoroccoAI, INPT, IMT Nord Europe, and Soft Centre. It targets young researchers, Ph.D. students, post‑docs, senior researchers and professionals, offering expert lectures, hands‑on labs, project work and networking opportunities. Participants will gain cutting‑edge knowledge of state‑of‑the‑art multimodal models and generative AI while building connections within Morocco's growing AI ecosystem.

name: AthNLP Summer School 2026
description: The Athens Natural Language Processing Summer School 2026 will be held at the NCSR Demokritos campus in Athens, Greece. The program, organized jointly by RC Athena, NCSR Demokritos, Athens University of Economics and Business, and Heriot‑Watt University, focuses on advanced topics in natural language processing. It offers participants a week‑long intensive learning experience from early September 2nd to 8th.

name: Advanced Artificial Intelligence: GenAI & Deep Unsupervised Learning
venue: Lady Margaret Hall, Oxford, United Kingdom
description: The Advanced Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning summer school focuses on generative AI and deep unsupervised learning techniques. It provides both theoretical foundations and hands‑on experience with real‑world applications, and is aimed at STEM students with intermediate AI/ML knowledge who are considering graduate study or research. The programme is offered as a residential or online course and runs from 29 June to 17 July 2026 at Lady Margaret Hall, Oxford.

name: AI4Science Summer School
description: The 2nd Summer School on Advancing Scientific Discovery with AI brings together researchers, PhD students and post‑doctoral scholars to explore how artificial intelligence can accelerate scientific research. The program covers machine learning for data analysis, AI‑driven experimental design, generative models, and the integration of AI with physical simulations, featuring hands‑on workshops using Python libraries such as NumPy and PyTorch. Held in Caen, Normandy, France, the school emphasizes deep‑learning techniques and requires participants to have prior experience with mathematical modelling and programming.

name: LUT Summer School
description: LUT Summer School 2026 is a one‑week intensive programme on the Lappeenranta campus offering courses on sustainability, climate action, marketing, management and the intersection of business and technology. It is aimed at bachelor’s and master’s students from any university who wish to gain interdisciplinary knowledge through workshops, group projects and hands‑on activities. Participants also enjoy a social programme set in the Finnish summer, including cultural events and outdoor activities.

name: Armenian LLM Summer School 2025
description: The LLM Summer School 2026 is an intensive program for students and researchers focusing on the latest advancements in Large Language Models. It will be held in Yerevan, Armenia and will feature a combination of lectures, hands‑on workshops, and a hackathon where participants can apply their knowledge to innovative projects. The event is part of an annual series that aims to provide comprehensive training and networking opportunities in the field of LLMs.
